name: Full Moon (Buck Moon)
description: Named for deer antlers; appears golden at moonrise

name: Mercury greatest eastern elongation
description: Mercury at its farthest evening separation from Sun

name: Moon–Saturn conjunction
description: The Moon passes close to Saturn in the sky

name: Moon–Pleiades occultation
description: Moon temporarily hides stars of the Pleiades cluster

name: Moon–Mars conjunction
description: The Moon and Mars appear near each other after sunset

name: Southern Delta Aquariids peak
description: Steady ~25 meteors/hour shower into Aquarius}

name: Alpha Capricornids peak
description: Produces bright fireballs, though lower rate

name: Perseid Meteor Shower peak
description: Bright, fast meteors at 50–100/hr—year’s best shower

name: Venus–Jupiter conjunction
description: Two brightest planets appear very close in dawn sky

name: Full Moon (Sturgeon Moon)
description: August full moon named for seasonal fish catch

name: Mercury greatest western elongation
description: Best morning visibility of Mercury apart from Sun

name: Total Lunar Eclipse
description: “Blood Moon”—Moon darkens red for ~82 min

name: Full Moon (Harvest Moon)
description: Full moon nearest autumnal equinox; aids late‑night harvest

name: Moon–Saturn conjunction
description: Moon and Saturn appear close in morning sky

name: Partial Solar Eclipse
description: Partial eclipse visible from parts of Oceania/Antarctica

name: Saturn opposition
description: Saturn opposite Sun—brightest and best viewed

name: September equinox
description: Day and night equal length; start of astronomical autumn

name: Full Moon (Hunter’s Supermoon)
description: Full ‘Hunter’s Moon’ appears slightly larger/brighter

name: Draconids peak
description: Minor shower radiates from Draco, visible after sunset

name: Orionids peak
description: Fast meteors from Halley’s comet at ~20/hr

name: Jupiter opposition
description: Jupiter opposite Sun—bright and all‑night visible

name: Full Moon (Beaver Supermoon)
description: Moon near perigee, brighter full ‘Beaver Moon’

name: Taurids peak
description: Slow, bright meteors; Southern Taurids active

name: Leonids peak
description: Fast meteors from Leonids; ~10–15/hr

name: Uranus opposition
description: Uranus brightest for year; telescope target

name: Full Moon (Cold Supermoon)
description: Full ‘Cold Moon’ supermoon about 8% larger

name: Moon–Pleiades conjunction
description: 98% Moon passes near Pleiades cluster

name: Phoenicids peak
description: Minor shower from Phoenix; variable rates

name: Geminids peak
description: One of best showers: up to ~120/hr, colorful

name: Ursids peak
description: Minor winter shower ~5–10/hr, dark moon

name: December solstice
description: Start of winter NH / summer SH—the year’s shortest day
